definition: to hang or suspend (from a hook etc)/to hang up (the phone)/(of a line) to be dead/to be worried or concerned/to make a phone call (dialect)/to register or record/classifier for sets or clusters of objects/(slang) to kill/to die/to be finished/to fail (an exam)
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: My line hadcaught on a small chip in the lip.
sentences.chinese: 我的繩子剛好掛住了這隻瓷盤邊上的一個小缺口。

sentences.english: Her dress got caught on a nail.
sentences.chinese: 她的衣服給釘子掛住了。

sentences.english: As I passed by, my skirt got caught on a nail.
sentences.chinese: 我經過的時候，我的裙子被釘子掛住了。
她的衣服被釘子掛住了。

sentences.english: Her hair was tangled up in the barbed wire fence.
sentences.chinese: 她的頭髮讓刺鋼絲籬笆給掛住了。

sentences.english: Her hair got all tangled up in the barbed wire fence.
sentences.chinese: 她的頭髮被刺鋼絲籬笆給掛住了。
釘子把她的大衣掛住了。

sentences.english: Her hair got all tangled up in the comb.
sentences.chinese: 她的頭髮讓梳子掛住了。

sentences.english: The thorns have caught our clothing.
sentences.chinese: 荊棘掛住了我們的衣服。
我的衣服被釘子掛住了。

sentences.english: Her skirt got caught on a nail.
sentences.chinese: 她的裙子給釘子掛住了。

sentences.english: Her skirt caught at the entrance.
sentences.chinese: 在進口處她的裙子給掛住了。

sentences.english: When the computer hangs up, you simply need to look at the P.
sentences.chinese: 當電腦掛住的時候，你可以簡單的看一下P。

sentences.english: I caught my dress on a nail .
sentences.chinese: 我的衣服被一根釘子掛住了。
